meanings.sent1: She tends to hyperbolize her achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to hyperbolize the dangers of the situation.
meanings.sent3: He always hyperbolizes his fishing stories, making them sound unbelievable.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was filled with hyperbolized promises that seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the hyperbolized size of the ice cream sundae.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more dramatic or impressive than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The movie director decided to hyperbolize the special effects for a more thrilling experience.
meanings.sent2: Advertisers often hyperbolize the benefits of their products to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The chef hyperbolized the flavors of the dish, claiming it was the best in the world.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to hyperbolize the significance of the event.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of color hyperbolized the beauty of the landscape painting.
